title: WeDo Template: Image Journaling Protocol (Rules Pseudolanguage)
description: Distilling raw visual artifacts (.png, .jpg) from the inbox into the temporal Heartwood via iterative metabolic loops.

storage_policy.mandate: Always copy the global template to the day's chrono-fractal json/ directory before starting work.

process_protocol.loop_instructions: Execute the following sequence in 3-by-3 metabolic batches to balance session velocity with human oversight:

steps.description: Print the current task list directly to the session feed for user review.
Read 3 artifacts from the inbox. Perform vision analysis on the batch. Post a high-fidelity summary of all 3 'straightup' for human-in-the-loop (HITL) oversight.
Copy the batch artifacts to their chronological destination. Artifacts MUST be renamed to user-friendly indexed names. Verify moves via 'Active Investigation' rule.
Append the descriptive batch to the daily image journal (.md). Group entries by batch to maintain structural clarity.
Once hardening is verified, move the batch source files to the 'journaled/' sub-folder.

rules.3_by_3_compromise: Batch operations in sets of 3 to prevent OOM-maxing and reduce human oversight fatigue.
rules.monotonic_growth: Journal word count must only increase.
rules.active_investigation: Verify existence of artifacts on localhost before inclusion.
rules.dual_referencing: Reference both localhost paths and remotehost URLs.
rules.chronological_integrity: ALWAYS append new entries to the absolute end of the file. Use the 'replace' tool with the last few lines of the file as context to ensure no out-of-order dangling entries remain.
rules.timestamp_verification: Verify that the artifact's source timestamp matches the destination directory's date before grafting.

task_structure.description: Metabolic Batch: [Summary of the 3 Visual Events]

sub_tasks.markdown_format:
